contentrichtext.text: {{italic title}} {{taxobox |name = ''Viola canina'' |image = Viola riviniana and canina.jpg |regnum = [[Plant]]ae |unranked_divisio = [[Angiosperms]] |unranked_classis = [[Eudicots]] |unranked_ordo = [[Rosids]] |ordo = [[Malpighiales]] |familia = [[Violaceae]] |genus = ''[[Viola (plant)|Viola]]'' |species = '''''V. canina''''' |binomial = ''Viola canina'' |binomial_authority = [[Carolus Linnaeus|L.]] <ref name=trop> ''Viola canina'' was first described and published in ''[[Species Plantarum]]'' 2: 935. 1753 {{ cite web |url=http://www.tropicos.org/Name/33800059 |title=Name - ''Viola canina'' L. |work=Tropicos |publisher=[[Missouri Botanical Garden]] |location=[[Saint Louis, Missouri]] |accessdate=August 21, 2011}}</ref> |}} '''''Viola canina''''' ('''Heath Dog-violet''' or '''Heath Violet''') is a species of the genus ''[[Violet (plant)|Viola]]'', native to [[Europe]], where it is found in the uplands of box hill in Dorset, [[heath (habitat)|heaths]], [[fen]]s, and moist woodlands, especially on acidic soils.<ref name=fbne>{{ cite book |author=Blamey, M. & Grey-Wilson, C. |year=1989 |title=Flora of Britain and Northern Europe |publisher=Hodder & Stoughton |isbn=0-340-40170-2.}}</ref> It is a [[herbaceous]] [[perennial plant]] growing to 5â€“15 cm tall. The flowers are pale blue, produced from April to July. Colonies of plants may be extensive.<ref name=fbne/> ==References== {{reflist}} [[Category:Viola|canina]] [[Category:Plants described in 1753]] [[Category:Flora of Europe]] [[Category:Flora of Finland]] [[Category:Flora of Russia]] [[Category:Flora of Great Britain]] {{Violaceae-stub}}
